alert.note: Alert for Isle of Wight; Southampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 1:36PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ISLE OF WIGHT... EASTERN SOUTHAMPTON AND EAST CENTRAL SUSSEX COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF FRANKLIN THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 136 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newsoms to near Zuni. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Franklin and Hunterdale around 140 PM EDT. Courtland, Newsoms, and Sedley around 145 PM EDT. Ivor around 150 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Vicksville, Handsom, Berlin, Manry, Collosse, Dory, Sunbeam, Lees Mill, Walters, and Sebrell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
